details.description: There is no law for a minimum or maximum temperature, but during working hours the temperature in all workplaces inside buildings must be reasonable
details.body:
During working hours the temperature in all indoor workplaces must be reasonable.

There’s no legal minimum or maximum, but guidance suggests a minimum of 16ºC (or 13ºC if employees are doing physical work).

There’s no maximum temperature limit.

Employers must stick to health and safety at work law, including:

  • keeping the temperature at a comfortable level
  • providing clean and fresh air

Employees should talk to their employer if the workplace temperature isn’t comfortable.
